text:
Home View All Jobs ( 2,596 ) DaVita Assistant Hospital Services Administrator in El Paso , Texas 
This position typically assists the Hospital Services Administrator or Group Hospital Services Administrator in managing the overall administration of activities associated with services to licensed Acute and Sub-Acute Care Facilities in the Hospital Services Group and for other services rendered off-site and not associated with on-site chronic dialysis clinics. This position provides supervision of professional and non-professional care and coordination of services to licensed acute hospitals and sub-acute facilities that have contracted with DaVita to provide dialysis and other services under the license of the Acute or Sub-Acute Facility 
SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES: 
Position has full supervisory responsibility for recruitment, hiring, onboarding, retention, performance development, performance management, teammate relations, team and teammate morale, salary adjustments, and termination of direct reports. Additional roles and responsibilities include program financial management, quality assurance, quality patient care, patient safety advocate, risk management, and other required duties that may arise during the general operations of the programs they oversee and manage. 
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: 
The following duties and responsibilities generally reflect the expectations of this position but are not intended to be all inclusive. 
Facility/Equipment Management (Assists HSA with): 
Ensure equipment and supplies are maintained to provide quality care and assure the safety of patients and staff 
Identify and plan prompt corrective action for any issues with building safety or equipment and systems in a standalone Acute facility or partner with hospital staff for safety and emergency preparedness (evacuation) training 
Know and follow hospital policies 
Participate in the development and periodic revision of policies and procedures with the Acute Facility Administrator/Regional Operations Director/Medical Director to ensure consistent, efficient and safe operation of the facility as assigned 
Financial Management (Assists HSA with) : 
Participate in budget formulation and review concerning personnel and scheduling needs with patient load 
Supervise inventory management including purchasing, product selection and supply usage 
Ensure patient and treatment charge information and other related data are accurate and submitted to the appropriate office in a timely manner 
Risk Management/Quality Assurance Compliance (Assists HSA with): 
Comply with DaVita policies and procedures in accordance with state and federal regulations for patient care and services (HIPAA, CMS, OSHA, or other governing agencies) 
Comply with state or federal regulations of the Injury Prevention and Safety Training Program 
Assist with the preparation of data summaries for internal audit purposes 
Assist with the creation and implementation of any corrective action needed as a result of internal or external quality assurance, Medicare, OSHA or other governing agencies 
Report and document all teammate injuries according to established policies and procedures 
Participate in quality assurance program with the Acute Facility Administrator, Regional Operations Director, and Quality Assurance Coordinator according to DaVita policy 
Patient Care Management (Assists HSA and works with Nurse in Charge of Nursing Services on): 
Participate in and ensure call responsibilities are carried out within the guidelines of the acute contract as allowed by individual state practice regulations 
Provide and oversee nursing, patient care, and technical services for patient treatment and ensure that appropriate adjustments in treatment plans are developed and implemented and meet compliance with state and federal governing agencies as allowed by individual state practice regulations 
Maintain communication and continuity of planned care when patient is transferred to other DaVita facilities 
Ensure placement of policies, procedures and resources to help the patient assume responsibility for his/her own health maintenance 
Maintain open communication with all partners including hospitals, physicians, nurse practitioners and other healthcare professionals regarding patient care 
Administer policies, procedures and resources to ensure safe, appropriate treatment of patients 
Act as a liaison with patients and hospital in response to complaints and quality issues. 
Teammate Management (Assists HSA with): 
Review and approve time cards of all teammates for payroll 
Understand basic wage and hour laws, federal, state and local laws and regulations, Medicare, and legislation affecting employment in dialysis and nursing services 
Plan, organize and supervise the technical and biomedical staff to ensure high quality patient care according to company policy 
Determine staffing plans that promote the most effective use of all teammates 
Develop and maintain educational programs to keep teammates up-to-date on nursing practices, universal precautions, worker/patient safety, etc. 
Provide day-to day work direction for nursing, technical, office and biomedical staff 
Oversee and/or implement all teammate activity such as hiring, promoting, job performance evaluations, and disciplinary actions with appropriate approval from the Acute Facility Administrator, Regional Operations Director and/or People Services Director/Manager 
Maintain teammate records to include written performance evaluation of all staff; records to be kept in compliance with DaVita policy and any applicable laws 
Evaluate, record and process teammate compensation according to company policy and upon approval by Acute FA and/or Group FA 
Understand and communicate DaVita company policies and procedures through the use of written policy manuals or in-service education 
Maintain knowledge of facility emergency management programs and ability to act swiftly, confidently in an emergency 
Maintain familiarity with DaVita programs impacting teammates (including but not limited to: Triple Crown, Nurse Tomorrow, We Are Here, Tuition Reimbursement, etc.) 
Other duties and responsibilities as assigned 
Attend team meetings, phone conferences, and training as needed 
Know, understand, and follow teammate guidelines, employment policies, and department or company procedures 
Here is what you can expect when you join our Village as an AHSA: 
A community first, company second culture based on Core Values that really matter. 
Clinical outcomes consistently ranked above the national average. 
Award-winning education and training across multiple career paths to help you reach your potential. 
Performance-based rewards based on stellar individual and team contributions. 
A comprehensive benefits package designed to enhance your health, your financial well-being and your future. 
Dedication, above all, to caring for patients suffering from chronic kidney failure across the nation. 
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS 
Education, licenses, certifications, and experience required to fulfill the essential duties, include computer skills as required. 
High school diploma or equivalent is required 
Associate’s or Bachelor’s degree in related area is preferred 
Active RN licensure required 
Minimum of 1 year’s healthcare leadership experience required; management experience strongly preferred 
Dialysis experience preferred 
Intermediate computer skills in Microsoft Office applications, including Word, Excel, and Outlook, and capability to gain proficiency in DaVita Hospital Services clinical and reporting software systems within 90 days or hire required 
Other qualifications and combinations of skills may be considered at discretion of ROD and/or Divisional Vice President
